name: Anton Arboleda
summary: Experienced senior software engineer with a focus on back-end, distributed systems, and observability. Seeking opportunities to build fault-tolerant, high-performance distributed systems and tackle large scale infrastructure challenges.
work_history:
Pinterest: Senior Software Engineer (March 2024 - Present) - Building a large scale ML Platform focusing on real-time ML feature infrastructure, feature store, and data standards using big data technologies.
Lyft: Senior Software Engineer (February 2022 - May 2023) - Designed and developed core caching component of a new logging pipeline, improved components to reduce on-call by 80%, and developed a streaming classification system. Team Lead and Software Engineer for Growth Platforms - Built an analytics ingestion platform, collaborated on high impact roadmaps, and mentored junior engineers.
Meta: Software Engineer (September 2017 - December 2019) - Worked on Data Center tooling and data ingestion pipelines.
Asian Tour: Professional Golfer (June 2014 - February 2016).
project_history: At Lyft, developed a novel streaming classification system for structural inference and significantly improved logging pipeline efficiency. At Pinterest, involved in building a large scale ML Platform with a focus on real-time features and data standards.
skills: Rust, Infrastructure, Logging, Big Data Technologies, ML Platforms, Data Standards, Observability, Distributed Systems
education: UCLA, Bradfield School of Computer Science, Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (2018 - 2020)

Summary
I am an experienced senior software engineer with a background
in back-end, distributed systems, and observability. I am seeking
opportunities to build fault-tolerant, high-performance distributed
systems, and to tackle large scale infrastructure challenges. In the
past, I've worked on distributed systems, infrastructure, growth
engineering and product development.
